awd_titl_txt: BCSER-IID: Foundations for a STEM What Work Clearinghouse for Broadening Participation Research in STEM Education
awd_abstract_narration:
The proposed project will lay the foundation for a clearinghouse of broadening participation STEM education research at Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs). The clearinghouse is envisioned as an online platform that will be populated with data collected through a systematic literature review during this initial phase. The investigator used the Vitae Researcher Development Framework to identify the STEM education research skills gaps that will be the focus of a comprehensive professional development. The professional development domains include knowledge and intellectual abilities; personal effectiveness; research governance and organization; and engagement, influence and impact. The goals will be accomplished by completing formalized training in meta-analysis research design and methodology, acquiring training in database foundations and data analytics, and receiving mentoring.  The project will position the investigator to contribute scholarship that informs effective interventions at HBCUs and topics for future research. 

The research project will produce a meta-analysis of NSF-funded broadening participation interventions at HBCUs by answering two research questions: (1) What broadening participation research interventions work and for whom? and (2) What are the mean corrected correlations between program traits in NSF-funded HBCU broadening participation interventions and student success metrics at HBCUs?  The research design is a quantitative retrospective systematic review. The rationale for this design selection is the power of meta-analytical studies for researchers. The research will be guided by expert mentors and informed by the expertise acquired through structured professional development activities. The research project, in the long term, is expected to provide accessible empirical data for investigators to conduct robust broadening participation in STEM education research studies. 

The project is supported through the EHR Core Research Building Capacity in STEM Education Research competition that is designed to build individuals' capacity to carry out high quality fundamental STEM education research in STEM learning and learning environments, broadening participation in STEM fields, and STEM workforce development.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
Foundations for a STEM What Works Clearinghouse for Broadening Participation in STEM Educatoin had a specific aim to develop the Principal Investigator’s skills and experience in study design, research methods, data analysis, synthesis, and/or subject-matter expertise inSTEM education. Specifically, this project will enhance my experience in the research method of meta-analysis, which is a design that is impactful for the entire field of STEM education research. Outcomes were operationalized in long, medium and short term. Long-term outcome of serve as an executive leader in research administration to support faculty in higher educationto expand their research agendas was met in year 2 of the project, The long term-performance outcome to codify a methodology for successful federal proposal funding that can be replicatedf or novice faculty researchers was met in year three and funded through NSF (award#2232286). Short term outcomes aligned with the objectives to develope a foundation for longitudinal research in the area of broadening participation research(BPR) through an established meta-analysis of NSF funded BP efforts at HBCUs ; facilitate the acquisition of education research expertise that will position the investigator to successfully conceive and execute fundamental STEM education research with the potential to meaningfully advance current knowledge about STEM learning and learning environments,broadening participation in STEM, and STEM workforce development; and prepare the investigator to compete successfully in EHR competitions that support fundamental STEM education research were met. Developing a foundation for longitudinal research and acquisition of SME in STEM eductaion reearch were evidenced in three publications specifc to STEM research at HBCUS, and an invited presentation and peer-reviewed conference presentation. 

Lynch, E. (2022). Why Ramping up Research at HBCU's is Critical for Improved Academic Innovation and Scholarship [Chap. 12]. In Smith-Ross, C. (Eds). Effects of the Covid-19 Pandemic on HBCU's Academic and Social Culture, Lewiston, ‎New York: Mellen Press.

Lynch, E., Towns, T., & Allen, L. (2022). Research: The New Frontier for All HBCUs. About Campus: Special Edition HBCUs. Sage Publications. doi: 10.1177/1086482220953220/ ID: ABC.2020.0028.

Lynch, E (2022. August). Our Strength is Internal: The Danger of Relying on New Philanthropic Interest in HBCUs as a Wave for Change. Diverse Online. [Op-Ed] https://www.diverseeducation.com/opinion/article/15295000/our-strength-is-internal-the-danger-of-relying-on-new-philanthropic-interest-in-hbcus-as-a-wave-for-change 

Invited Panelist, National Association of Student Professional Administrators (Region 3) Sept. 2020 The Importance of Research at HBCUs

Co-Presenter, AAC&U Transforming STEM in Higher Education, Digital Conference 5 Nov. 2021 What Works for Broadening Participation: Meta-Analytical Findings from NSF sponsored Broadening Participation Efforts at Historically Black Colleges and Universities

 The outcome to prepare the investigator to compete successfully in EHR competitions that support fundamental STEM education research was evidenced in acqusition of not only NSF funding in STEM education research (Award#2232286 and 2203379) as well as Lumina, Sloan, Gates, and Hessing foundation funding to develop a co-designed college student success framework with Indegenous communities for STEM student success. 


Last Modified: 06/26/2024
Modified by: Erin M Lynch
